experience: You and Kristin both know Kyle Burnett, Eric Keosky-Smith, and 131 others

Kristin is the Founder, CEO and Lead Collaborator of Like the Lettuce, LLC---  a boutique international collaboration firm made up of industry experts whose expertise is specifically on launching and growing organizations, small business and startups.  If you have an idea-- we can help you make it real.  Kristin leads a world-wide dream team whose common thread is that they have all “been there, done that” and  worked directly in organizations and companies  with small teams and limited resources.  As the Lead Collaborator, Kristin draws on her varied experience in the for-profit, nonprofit, startup and tech world to provide clients with access to an entire suite of services that empower organizations and projects with budgets under $5 million to grow their visions.  Highly selective in their clientele-- Like the Lettuce only takes on a select number of clients per year.  Like the Lettuce is also the leading provider offer white glove consulting services for high profile/celebrity lead nonprofit and community projects to maximize their impact.

A Phoenix fintech startup, ProvideHER is disrupting the financial sector by assisting everyday women to embrace their fiscal power as ProvideHERs and change the world. Through a digital savings application and a peer to peer lending marketplace, ProvideHER seeks to level up the financial game for women by providing them with solutions designed with their fiscal motivations in mind.  Everyday Women & Some Change.

The best 6 months of my life!   I took 6 months up in the woods of northern AZ with my wonderful family to set my goals and direction for the next 7 years.  I read, I learned how to cook my dad's spaghetti sauce, I had crazy leggings parties with my niece, and I let my thoughts and ideas settle and simmer.  I intend to make this a habit every 7 years and I am already planning for my next Radbatical in 2023.  I will be posting to a new blog in the coming months about my experience and providing some mini-sabbatical activities in the real-world for people who cannot break away for this amount of time.

StartupAZ is a collaborative fund at the Arizona Community Foundation formed with a vision of making Arizona the most generous community of entrepreneurs in the world.  As Interim Executive Director , assisted in the formation of the founding board of directors, established initial budget, formed community grants committee and facilitated a CEO/Founders retreat for scaling startups.  Managed day to day operations including financials, social media, and community relations.

CO+HOOTS is a coworking space in downtown Phoenix.  In 2014, it was decided that they would develop a nonprofit arm called the CO+HOOTS FOUNDATION to do outreach, education and further empower coworkers making the world even more awesome. CO+ Foundation is a nonprofit whose mission is to connect communities, sectors, and humanity to build the future.  We provide pro-bono service, education, and leadership to CO+WORK- CO+BUILD- CO+CHANGE the world.

The Welcome to America Project is a nonprofit organization that creates community connections and builds bridges of neighborly understanding by providing furniture, basic necessities, education, and additional resources to newly arriving refugees.We offer a simple welcoming gesture, but it is one that lasts a lifetime.http://www.wtap.org/

Working with a team of other young talent leaders, Kristin facilitates the project management for the Manifesto Project. She is focused on engaging and engineering the strategy behind the project and empowering the group and our members to achieve organizational and personal impact milestones. Sparked by the Center for the Future of Arizona's The Arizona We Want 2.0 report, The Manifesto Project is asking the question: How does Arizona engage its young leaders & attract young talent?Through three open-ended questions, The Manifesto Project will capture the voice of a generation of young adults in Arizona.Currently a fall Seedspot Venture, the Manifesto Project is developing a national model for engaging young talent by using Arizona, the youngest of the 48 contiguous states, as a opportunity oasis for young leaders and young talent. The Manifesto Project believes THERE IS NOTHING MORE INSPIRING THAN A YOUNG PERSON WITH A STRATEGIC DREAM AND THE TALENT TO MAKE IT A REALITY.The Manifesto Project mission is to make AZ "the place to be for young talent ages 18-39" and to collect data to show other communities and states nationally how the echo generations collective voice, their contributions to the community, and their economic impact is going to reshape the nation. Our end goal is to maximize how organizations and governments tap into the power and talent of its young innovative leaders.

Through a model of impact business design- very nice has been able to donate over $3.75MM worth of pro-bono services, while simultaneously inspiring thousands of practitioners to partake in pro-bono service. Their new service, Models of Impact, is getting incredible traction and is on its way to becoming a standard resource for Social Entrepreneurs. Verynice has been featured in Forbes 6 times, and their founder, Matthew Manos,  was even named One of Seven Millennials Changing the World by The Huffington Post. As a founding advisory council member, Kristin is working to advance the concepts of Models if Impact into the business community and promoting pro bono service as an economic driver for the nonprofit sector.

recommendations: Peter Menna
Managing Director/ Tenant Representation Group at Cushman & Wakefield
November 4, 2017, Peter was a client of Kristin’s

I had the pleasure of working with Peter when the CO+HOOTS Foundation and CO+HOOTS coworking space were seeking the space in Midtown. Most recently I am on the Advisory Board of Hera Hub Phoenix coworking space and he helped them to find the perfect location.  Coworking is a challenging category to find property in but more importantly a commercial realtor who gets that coworking isn't just a big open space-- it's a community designed space.  Peter understands the  unique challenges with tenant improvements, parking, and other open space needs.  He also knows how to explain this business model to  landlords and property owners who don't necessarily fully understand.  My favorite part of working with Peter was that before meetings he would always coach us on what to expect, and during meetings he always made sure things were clear on all sides with next steps outlined so that the project didn't lag.   I am grateful to have worked with him and as a result consider him not just a tremendous realtor, but  a wonderful mentor and friend.

Susan Baier
Mind-Blowing Audience Segmentation Research
October 4, 2013, Kristin worked with Susan but at different companies

Susan provided the fall Seedspot Ventures in Phoenix with a workshop on how to develop a 6 step marketing plan strategy for our start-ups.  It was easy to remember, simple to follow and she guided us through the process.   Her enthusiasm, content knowledge and willingness to help our start-up businesses grow was truly apparent.  She also provided us with excellent examples of her work with larger corporations and was able to scale that down to what that would look like for our companies.  Best presenter in the program so far! :)

summary: My life mission is to #scatterjoy and be a ProvideHER to my family, community and world. I grows visions with innovation & BIG impacts!  Contagious enthusiasm is how I approach my work and world. My talents are expressed most powerfully in growth mindset cultures  where I can apply creativity and execution of measurable benchmarks.  A natural connector and strategist, I am a great person to come to when you are trying to figure out how to get from A->B.  I work with nonprofits, small business, startups and organizations who are ready to innovate for maximum growth. I hope to always be the biggest KID in the room with larger than life dreams who colors outside the lines across borders and barriers that traditionally divide. Mentoring and paying it forward to others is a large part of my life in addition to developing  a global family of the most innovative changemakers who will team up with me on larger than life missions to solve world problems.  STRENGTHS FINDER 5 CORE STRENGTHS: Activator, Woo, Strategic, Communication, Futuristic Myers Briggs:  ENFP2017 DESIRED FEELINGS: Presence, Connection, Flow, Expression, Adventure, Dance. My professional career has been a wonderful adventure. I have successfully helped launch 4 nonprofits and raised nearly $75 million to date.  I focus my work on growing visions because I have started organizations and been on successful launch teams.  I have worn all of the hats and as a lifelong learner and deeply rooted in personal growth I hope to spend my entire career asking questions, acquiring new skills, and meeting passionate people who are committed to growth in every aspect of their life. Strategic Planning Certificate-- Institute for Cultural Affairs (ICA) Action Planning and Facilitative Leadership Certificate-  Institute for Cultural Affairs (ICA)  Life Coach Certification- Southwest Institute for the Healing ArtsSpiritual Direction Certificate--Urban Spirituality Center (Portland, OR) to be completed in 2017
